bibl.title: Thomas Kerr v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington, County of King ss
In the district court hilding terms atvSeattlew.
In the matter of the application of Thomas Kerr For a writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Thomas Burke Judge of said Court.

Your petitioner Thomas Kerr would most respectfully show That he is unlawfully imprisoned detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by William Cochrane Sheriff of King County Washington Territory, in a wooden frame building recently constructed by the said William Cochrane and situated near the court house in the City of Seattle in said County and Territory.

That the cause or pretense of the restraint according to the best of knowledge and belief of your petitioner is is a certain so called warrant of commitment dated the 15th. day of December 1888 and signed by one N. Soderberg a Justice of the Peace in and for said County.

That said imprisoned and restraint is illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this that the said Justice of the Peace N. Soderberg has no power under klaw to try petitioner for the offense described in said commitment. A copy of said commitment is hereto attached marked, exhibit A, and made a part of this petition.

That the said pretened warrant of commitment is and arbitrary order for imprisonment of your petitioner without any just cause therefor and that the same is wholly null and void and is no authority to said sheriff for the imprisonment of your petitioner.

Wherefor your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said William Cochrane sheriff as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of the said Thomas Kerr before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive which shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning said Thomas Kerr together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ; and that he said Kerr may be restored to, his liberty.
Osborn + Dyer Attys for petitioner
Territory of Washington, County of King ss
Thomas Kerr being duly sworn on oath states that he is the petitioner in the foregoing petition that he has heard the same read knows the contents thereof and believed the same to be true.
Thomas Kerr Subscribed and sworn to before me Feb 8th 1889
Richard Osborn Notary Public
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
Territory of Washington, County of King ss
In the Justice's Court, Seattle Precinct, King County, W.T. before N. Soderberg J.P.
Exhibit "A"
Territory of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. Thomas Kerr, Defendant
To H.G. Thornton and the keeper of the jail of said King County W.T.

Whereas, At a Justice's court held at my office, in said County, for the trial of Thomas Kerr for the offense hereinafter states, the said Thomas Kerr was convicted of having on the 13 day of December 1888 in said County, commited vagrancy and upon conviction, the said court did adjudge and determine that the said Thomas Kerr should give a bond in $50 for his good behavior for 90 days to the Territory of Washington and dollars costs, and stand commited 90 days or until the same be paid: And whereas the said Thomas Kerr has made default in the payment of the same. Therefore you, the said Thomas Kerr are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said Thomas Kerr to the said keeper; and you the said keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said Thomas Kerr into your custody in said jail and him there keep at hard labor for the space of 90 days, unless said fine and costs be sooner paid or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 15 day of December 1888.
N. Soderberg, Justice of the Peace.
In the matter of the application of Thomas Kerr for writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED FEB 9 1889 W.E. Ledgerwood
